text: Julien Fourgeaud (25 April 1980 - 6 August 2014) was a French businessman and inventor. He was the digital services product strategist for Finnish video game developer Rovio. His work at the company led to the success of Angry Birds. He later co-founded Scarlet Motors. He also worked for the mobile phone company Nokia. He was born in Cluses, Haute-Savoie. Fourgeaud died in a BASE jumping accident on 6 August 2014 in Magland. He was 34. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1980 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls Category:BASE jumpers Category:Deaths in sport Category:French businesspeople Category:French inventors Category:Sportspeople from Auvergne-Rh√¥ne-Alpes
title: Julien Fourgeaud
